result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla M. Anderson

defendant.name: Anderson, Kayla M.
defendant.address: 641 S. Park St., Richland Center, WI 53581

records.addlTxt: 01:16 PM Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by phone means for Defendant Kayla M. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kayla M. Anderson appeared by video means. Attorney Angel informs the court of the joint agreement to amend 22CM07 to 79.4 and dismiss 22CM03. State moves to dismiss all TR cases. NC plea entered. Court orders 150 plus costs in 22CM1 and all other cases are dismissed.
Status conference on March 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:04 PM 22CM01/22CM03 - Defendant Kayla M. Anderson appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by video means for Defendant Kayla M. Anderson. Attorney Angel has review the complaint, waives the formal reading and stands mute. Max penalties stated.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: to Those Posting Cash Bond (signed 1/2/22 by DJ; received and filed with the court 1/3/22)

RCSD Book and Release Bond. Conditions: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.
